title: Build a Simple Todo List Application
description:
Create a todo list application that allows users to add, remove, and toggle completion status of todo items using useState hook.

**Requirements:**
- Create a functional component named `TodoList`
- Initialize state with an empty array of todos
- Each todo item should have: id (unique), text (string), completed (boolean)
- Add an input field and button to create new todos
- Display todos in a list with each item showing:
  - Todo text
  - Checkbox to toggle completion status
  - Delete button to remove the todo
- Show statistics: total todos and completed todos count
- Style completed todos with strikethrough text

**Features to Implement:**
1. Add new todo (text from input, default completed: false)
2. Toggle todo completion (checkbox click)
3. Delete todo (button click)
4. Clear input after adding todo
5. Show statistics at the bottom

**Expected Behavior:**
- New todos appear at the bottom of the list
- Clicking checkbox toggles strikethrough styling
- Delete button removes only that todo
- Statistics update in real-time
- Input clears after adding todo

**Example Todo Structure:**
```javascript
{
  id: 1,
  text: "Learn React Hooks",
  completed: false
}
```
description_preview: Create a todo list app with add, toggle, and delete functionality using useState
hints: Use useState to manage both the todo list array and the input text
Generate unique IDs for each todo (can use Date.now() or a counter)
Remember to never mutate state directly - always create new arrays/objects
Use the map function to render the todo list and filter function for deletion
